Wolfenstein 3D is still one of my favorite games, so I was excited to have a chance to play another game that used its engine. Its goofy novelty may wear off soon for some of you, but I really enjoy it. If you want an old shooter but need guns, you can always try the fine Blake Stone series as well.  The only cons of the game are the weapons that obscure the screeen and the repetition of the enemies. For some reason it is more pronounced than Wolf3D (I could buy the armies of Nazi soldiers all looking the same) but for a game that offers biblical quiz sections, it's odd seeing hundreds of one type of animal.

Super 3-D Noah's Ark. Now if that isn't a title that sells itself, I don't know what is.  S3DNA is a Wolfenstein 3D clone, and before I say anything more, I feel like I should start with:  it's actually not bad . In fact, it's pretty decent. If you like Wolfenstein 3D, that is. And I do! Very much.  All the animals on the ark have grown roudy. As Noah, it's up to you to feed them all (or as many as you have to until you've beaten the six bosses, anyways) so that they'll go to sleep. In order to streamline this process, you'll be shooting the feed at their faces using various slingshots and what-have-you. Basically, what we have here, is a kid-friendly Wolfenstein 3D.  Now, you've probably mostly all seen the Angry Video Game Nerd's review of the original Super Nintendo game. The one that came in a jank bootleg cartridge that required you to plug another game into the top of it because Nintendo never gave the game their approval. If you haven't, here you go:         YouTube™ Video:  Bible Games - Angry Video Game Nerd - Episode 17
A hungry sheep spat at me, so I fed the sheep, causing it to fall asleep and drop a box with even more feed.  Game of the Year.
This game may in fact be the greatest game of 2016. And 2017. Probably 2018, but lets not push it.

Are you a secret agent sent by America to take down Hitler's 3rd Reich? NO!!! You are Noah! A divinely chosen warrior, at the helm of your warship, the Ark, on a mission from God to save all mankind from the briney clutches of Satan! Ha! Blazkowicz has got naught on this!   Things are quiet aboard the Ark... too quiet... when treachery strikes! The Goat from below the darkest depths compels his minions, who have covertly possessed various animals onboard, to ingnite a rebellion. The demonic animals are loose, and out for blood. It's up to you to put. them. down... to sleep! For only then may the taint be ripped from their souls! Armed with with various... um... arms, and a whole lot of the body of Christ, your high seas crusade begins!  With the best graphics and mechanics this side of 1992, I highly recommend this gritty reimagining of one of the most important moments in biblical history.  For the ultimate experience mute the game's soundtrack and play some metal instead.

This game provides an accurate depiction of biblical events that happened with the famous Noah's Ark. However, they may be accurate, but they are also secret. When you play this... journey, you're getting more than just nonstop action. You're also getting the untold stories of Noah's adventures on his Ark. As you seed your way through hordes of animals, just remember that this is true. This all happened. You are playing a part of history, my friends, and I want you all to know it. While you force feed food down the throats of goats, I want you all to take a moment to stop and think about what you're doing... want to know what you're doing? You're continuing the legacy of the great Noah from Genesis (the Bible one, not the Sega one).

Do you wish your video games paid a little more attention to the ever-increasing progressive needs of middle-class America? Do you value narrative, kinaesthetic resonance, and the disassembly of the current gamer culture over all else in your interactive media? With Super 3-D Noah's Ark, you'll find a wealth of artistic treaure. Originally released as 'Noah no Daibouken: Kokoro Shimapan' for the Japan-only FM Towns Marty, S3DNA is revolutionary for it's time in it's portrayal (and subsequent deconstruction) of the Catholic faith. Over 5 hand-crafted worlds, you'll experience the highs and lows of this classic character's plight to save not only mankind, but art as well. My one complaint would have to be the exclusion of VR support - a world this lovingly sculpted deserves to be experienced to the fullest my human senses will allow.
This raw and gritty prequel story to the events of Wolfenstein 3-D packs as much of a punch as a Robo-Suit Hitler with chaingun arms.

This is an ace game. It is challenging, more than Wolfenstein 3D or DOOM. I used to play this on SNES.  The new controls are a significant update. Quick mouse aiming rather than slow D-pad. I don't think it was even possible to strafe on the SNES version. Movement is much more fluid now. The graphics and sound are very clear. The OST isn't as good as DOOM's. The player is asked bible questions. YES! This is a top feature.  10/10, best Wolfenstein.
